title.rendered: Introduction to Private Sponsorship of Refugees Information Session: The Focus on Groups of Five and Community Sponsors

content.rendered:
An information session aimed at individuals and groups interested in learning more about the Private Sponsorship of Refugees (PSR) program, specifically focusing on the Group of Five and Community Sponsor categories. This session provides a comprehensive overview of the PSR program, eligibility criteria, and the roles and responsibilities of sponsors.

We are delighted to announce that this event has received support from the Intercultural Association of Greater Victoria. Their expertise and commitment to promoting intercultural understanding and refugee resettlement make them invaluable partners for this session.

Attending this information session will give you a deeper understanding of the Group of Five and Community Sponsor categories, the application process, and the importance of sponsorship in supporting refugees’ successful resettlement. Whether you are an individual, a community group, or an organization, this session will equip you with the knowledge and resources necessary to impact the lives of refugees positively.

We’d like you to join us for this enlightening session and discover how you can create a welcoming and inclusive community for refugees. Together, let’s embrace diversity and build a brighter future for all.
